info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 8:00AM CDT until March 30 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LITTLE RIVER...SOUTHEASTERN MCCURTAIN...NORTHWESTERN CASS...WESTERN BOWIE AND NORTHEASTERN MORRIS COUNTIES... At 759 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of De Kalb to near Rocky Branch, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... New Boston, Foreman, Daingerfield, De Kalb, Naples, Rocky Branch, Marietta, Wallace, Almont, Spring Hill and Bryans Mill. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...southeastern Oklahoma...and northeastern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
